info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 9:04PM CDT until March 29 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Green Bay WI
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain. Additional ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. For the Ice Storm Warning, significant icing expected. Total snow and sleet accumulations between 1 and 3 inches and ice accumulations between one quarter and one half inch. Locally higher ice accumulations possible.
* WHERE...Oneida, Florence, Forest, and Northern Marinette County Counties.
* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM CDT Saturday. For the Ice Storm Warning, from 7 PM Saturday to 7 PM CDT Sunday.
* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice Saturday night into Sunday. Travel could be nearly impossible.
info.instruction:
Be prepared for slippery roads tonight. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
Travel is strongly discouraged Saturday night into Sunday. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...ICE STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM SATURDAY TO 7 PM CDT SUNDAY

area.areaDesc: Oneida; Forest; Florence; Northern Marinette County
